Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
groundbreaking \ground"break`ing\ n. The ceremonial breaking of the ground to formally begin a construction project. It is sometimes carried out by an official who digs the first spadeful of dirt from the ground, to begin the preparatory excavation work.
Syn: groundbreaking ceremony. [WordNet 1.5]

groundbreaking adj : being or producing something like nothing done or experienced or created before; "stylistically innovative works"; "innovative members of the artistic community"; "a mind so innovational, so original" [syn: {innovative}, {innovational}] n : the ceremonial breaking of the ground to formally begin a construction project [syn: {groundbreaking ceremony}]
